description: The NK1 segment contains information about the patient's other related parties. Any associated parties may be identified. Utilizing NK1-1-set ID, multiple NK1 segments can be sent to patient accounts

1.name: Set Id - Next Of Kin
1.description: uniquely identifies the NK1 records for the purpose of adding, changing, or deleting records. For those messages that permit segments to repeat, the Set ID field is used to identify the repetitions. For example, the swap and query transactions allow for multiple PID segments would have Set ID values of 1, 2, then 3, etc.

10.name: Next Of Kin
10.description: title of the next of kin at their place of employment

11.name: Next Of Kin Job Code / Class
11.description: the employers Job Code or Employee Classification used for the next of kin at their place of employment

12.name: Next Of Kin Employee Number
12.description: number the employer assigns to the employee that is acting as next of kin

13.name: Organization Name
13.description: in cases where an employer serves as next of kin, this is the name of the organization which serves as the next of kin. This field may also be used to communicate the name of the organization where the next of kin works.

2.name: Name
2.description: name of the next of kin

3.name: Relationship
3.description: defines the actual personal relationship that the next of kin has to the patient. Refer to user-defined table 0063 - relationship. Examples might include: brother, sister, mother, father, friend, spouse, emergency contact, employer, etc

4.name: Address
4.description: defines the address of the associated party

5.name: Phone Number
5.description: defines the telephone number of the associated party

6.name: Business Phone Number
6.description: defines the business telephone number of the associated party

7.name: Contact Role
7.description: indicates the specific relationship role (next of kin, employer, emergency contact, etc.). Refer to userdefined table 0131 - contact role. This field specifies the role that the next of kin plays with regards to the patient. For example, an employer, emergency contact, next of kin, insurance company, state agency, federal agency etc.
